analysisVariables.description: Flag for exclusion of a record into a PK NCA calculation (Y = exclusion, Null = inclusion)
analysisVariables.label: PK NCA Exclusion Flag
analysisVariables.name: NCAXFL

parentProduct.title: Analysis Data Model Implementation Guide for Non-compartmental Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Numeric flag for exclusion of a record into a PK NCA calculation (1 = exclusion, Null = inclusion). NCAXFN can only be included if NCAXFL is also included.
analysisVariables.label: PK NCA Exclusion Flag (N)
analysisVariables.name: NCAXFN

parentProduct.title: Analysis Data Model Implementation Guide for Non-compartmental Analysis

self.title: Reason w for PK NCA Exclusion

analysisVariables.description: This variable is used to explain why the record is not included in the PK NCA.
analysisVariables.label: Reason w for PK NCA Exclusion
analysisVariables.name: NCAwXRS

parentProduct.title: Analysis Data Model Implementation Guide for Non-compartmental Analysis

self.title: Reason for PK NCA Exclusion of w (N)

analysisVariables.description: This variable is used to explain why the record is not included in the PK NCA.
analysisVariables.label: Reason for PK NCA Exclusion of w (N)
analysisVariables.name: NCAwXRSN

parentProduct.title: Analysis Data Model Implementation Guide for Non-compartmental Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Flag for exclusion of a record from a PK summary (1 = exclusion, Null = inclusion)
analysisVariables.label: PK Summary Exclusion Flag
analysisVariables.name: PKSUMXF

parentProduct.title: Analysis Data Model Implementation Guide for Non-compartmental Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Numeric flag for exclusion of a record from a PK summary (1 = exclusion, Null = inclusion). PKSUMXFN can only be included if PKSUMXFL is also included.
analysisVariables.label: PK Summary Exclusion Flag (N)
analysisVariables.name: PKSUMXFN

parentProduct.title: Analysis Data Model Implementation Guide for Non-compartmental Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Flag to designate if observations within a subject are associated with a metabolite. Required if parent drug and metabolites are present in the dataset.
analysisVariables.label: Metabolite Flag
analysisVariables.name: METABFL

parentProduct.title: Analysis Data Model Implementation Guide for Non-compartmental Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Relevant to trials where cohorts are defined. This could be another grouping not necessarily associated with ARM.
analysisVariables.label: Subject Cohort
analysisVariables.name: COHORT

parentProduct.title: Analysis Data Model Implementation Guide for Non-compartmental Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Numeric representation of the COHORT variable. There must be a one-to-one mapping between COHORT and COHORTN. When COHORT and COHORTN are present, then, on a given record, either both must be populated or both must be null.
analysisVariables.label: Subject Cohort (N)
analysisVariables.name: COHORTN

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66729

parentProduct.title: Analysis Data Model Implementation Guide for Non-compartmental Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Route of treatment delivery. This variable can be a copy of EX.EXROUTE or EC.ECROUTE. May instead be derived from the EX.EXROUTE or EC.ECROUTE.
analysisVariables.label: Route
analysisVariables.name: ROUTE

parentProduct.title: Analysis Data Model Implementation Guide for Non-compartmental Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Planned time between 2 consecutive treatments in multiple-dose studies (sometimes referred to as "Tau")
analysisVariables.label: Planned Treatment Interval
analysisVariables.name: TRTRINT

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Analysis Data Model Implementation Guide for Non-compartmental Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Units associated with TRTRINT
analysisVariables.label: Planned Treatment Interval Units
analysisVariables.name: TRTRINTU

parentProduct.title: Analysis Data Model Implementation Guide for Non-compartmental Analysis

self.title: Percent Diff. Nominal vs. Actual Dose

analysisVariables.description: Derived variable using a standard percent difference formula: (100*(DOSEA-DOSEP)/(DOSEP)). DOSPCTDF is required if both DOSEA and DOSEP are populated.
analysisVariables.label: Percent Diff. Nominal vs. Actual Dose
analysisVariables.name: DOSPCTDF

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71113

parentProduct.title: Analysis Data Model Implementation Guide for Non-compartmental Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Usually expressed as the number of repeated administrations of DOSE within a specific time period for multiple dose studies.
analysisVariables.label: Dose Frequency
analysisVariables.name: DOSEFRQ

parentProduct.title: Analysis Data Model Implementation Guide for Non-compartmental Analysis

analysisVariables.description: This is a record-level identifier that reflects cycle and may be of particular importance for studies that examine concentrations in cancer patients. There must be a one-to-one mapping between ACYCLE and ACYCLEC. When ACYCLE and ACYCLEC are present, then, on a given record, either both must be populated or both must be null.
analysisVariables.label: Analysis Cycle
analysisVariables.name: ACYCLE

parentProduct.title: Analysis Data Model Implementation Guide for Non-compartmental Analysis

analysisVariables.description: Character representation of the ACYCLE variable. Text characterizing to which analysis cycle the record belongs. This is a record-level identifier that reflects cycle and may be of particular importance for studies that examine concentrations in cancer patients. There must be a one-to-one mapping between ACYCLE and ACYCLEC. When ACYCLE and ACYCLEC are present, then, on a given record, either both must be populated or both must be null.
analysisVariables.label: Analysis Cycle (C)
analysisVariables.name: ACYCLEC

parentProduct.title: Analysis Data Model Implementation Guide for Non-compartmental Analysis

self.title: First Date of Dose for Analyte

analysisVariables.description: Date of first exposure to treatment associated with PARAM and ANALYTE for a subject in a study where multiple doses have been given. Note that FANLDT may not match TRTSDT or any of TRxxSDT values.
analysisVariables.label: First Date of Dose for Analyte
analysisVariables.name: FANLDT

parentProduct.title: Analysis Data Model Implementation Guide for Non-compartmental Analysis

self.title: First Time of Dose for Analyte

analysisVariables.description: Time of first exposure to treatment associated with PARAM and ANALYTE for a subject in a study where multiple doses have been given. If treatment is given over a duration multiple times, this variable will reflect the start time of the first dose.
analysisVariables.label: First Time of Dose for Analyte
analysisVariables.name: FANLTM

parentProduct.title: Analysis Data Model Implementation Guide for Non-compartmental Analysis

self.title: First Datetime of Dose for Analyte

analysisVariables.description: Date and time of first exposure to treatment associated with PARAM and ANALYTE for a subject in a study where multiple doses have been given. If treatment is given over a duration multiple times, this variable will reflect the start date and time of the first dose.
analysisVariables.label: First Datetime of Dose for Analyte
analysisVariables.name: FANLDTM

parentProduct.title: Analysis Data Model Implementation Guide for Non-compartmental Analysis

self.title: First End Date of Dose for Analyte

analysisVariables.description: End date of first exposure to treatment associated with PARAM and ANALYTE for a subject in a study where multiple doses have been given. Note that FANLEDT may not match TRTEDT or any of TRxxEDT values.
analysisVariables.label: First End Date of Dose for Analyte
analysisVariables.name: FANLEDT

parentProduct.title: Analysis Data Model Implementation Guide for Non-compartmental Analysis

self.title: First End Time of Dose for Analyte

analysisVariables.description: End time of first exposure to treatment associated with PARAM and ANALYTE for a subject in a study where multiple doses have been given. If treatment is given over a duration multiple times, this variable will reflect the end time of the first dose.
analysisVariables.label: First End Time of Dose for Analyte
analysisVariables.name: FANLETM

self.title: First End Datetime of Dose for Analyte

analysisVariables.description: End date and time of first exposure to treatment associated with PARAM and ANALYTE for a subject in a study where multiple doses have been given. If treatment is given over a duration multiple times, this variable will reflect the end date and time of the first dose.

analysisVariables.name: FANLEDTM

self.title: Reference Date of Dose for Analyte

analysisVariables.description: Date of reference exposure to treatment associated with PARAM and ANALYTE. Based on PC.PCRFTDTC and related to the analyzed profile. If this is a treatment over time, then this is typically the start of the dosing duration.
analysisVariables.label: Reference Date of Dose for Analyte
analysisVariables.name: PCRFTDT

parentProduct.title: Analysis Data Model Implementation Guide for Non-compartmental Analysis

self.title: Reference Time of Dose for Analyte

analysisVariables.description: Time of reference exposure to treatment associated with PARAM and ANALYTE. Based on PC.PCRFTDTC and related to the analyzed profile. If this is a treatment over time, then this is typically the start of the dosing duration.
analysisVariables.label: Reference Time of Dose for Analyte
analysisVariables.name: PCRFTTM

parentProduct.title: Analysis Data Model Implementation Guide for Non-compartmental Analysis

self.title: Reference Datetime of Dose for Analyte

analysisVariables.description: Date and time of reference exposure to treatment associated with PARAM and ANALYTE. Based on PC.PCRFTDTC and related to the analyzed profile. If this is a treatment over time, then this is typically the start of the dosing duration.
analysisVariables.label: Reference Datetime of Dose for Analyte
analysisVariables.name: PCRFTDTM

parentProduct.title: Analysis Data Model Implementation Guide for Non-compartmental Analysis

self.title: Reference End Date of Dose for Analyte

analysisVariables.description: The end date of reference exposure to treatment associated with PARAM and ANALYTE. Must be related to the time recorded in PC.PCRFTDTC and to the analyzed profile. If dosing occurs over an interval, this should be populated. If populated, ADOSEDUR and DOSEDURU are required to be filled out.
analysisVariables.label: Reference End Date of Dose for Analyte
analysisVariables.name: PCRFEDT

parentProduct.title: Analysis Data Model Implementation Guide for Non-compartmental Analysis

self.title: Reference End Time of Dose for Analyte

analysisVariables.description: The end time of the reference exposure to treatment associated with PARAM and ANALYTE. Must be related to the time recorded in PC.PCRFTDTC and to the analyzed profile. If dosing occurs over an interval, this should be populated. If populated, ADOSEDUR and DOSEDURU are required to be filled out.
analysisVariables.label: Reference End Time of Dose for Analyte
analysisVariables.name: PCRFETM

parentProduct.title: Analysis Data Model Implementation Guide for Non-compartmental Analysis

self.title: Ref. End Datetime of Dose for Analyte

analysisVariables.description: The end date and time of the reference exposure to treatment associated with PARAM and ANALYTE. Must be related to the time recorded in PC.PCRFTDTC and to the analyzed profile. If dosing occurs over an interval, this should be populated. If populated, ADOSEDUR and DOSEDURU are required to be filled out.
analysisVariables.label: Ref. End Datetime of Dose for Analyte
analysisVariables.name: PCRFEDTM

parentProduct.title: Analysis Data Model Implementation Guide for Non-compartmental Analysis

self.title: Nom. Rel. Time from Analyte First Dose

analysisVariables.description: This is the planned elapsed time (for sample point or start of sampling interval) from first exposure to treatment associated with PARAM and ANALYTE. For studies with an extended duration infusion, use the define to document if this is from the start or end of the infusion.
analysisVariables.label: Nom. Rel. Time from Analyte First Dose
analysisVariables.name: NFRLT

parentProduct.title: Analysis Data Model Implementation Guide for Non-compartmental Analysis

self.title: Act. Rel. Time from Analyte First Dose

analysisVariables.description: This is the actual elapsed time (for sample point or start of sampling interval) from first exposure to treatment associated with PARAM and ANALYTE. Note that this is referring to the first dose available for a particular drug. It is useful in multiple-dosing situations.
analysisVariables.label: Act. Rel. Time from Analyte First Dose
analysisVariables.name: AFRLT

self.title: Nom. Rel. End Time from First Dose

analysisVariables.description: This is the planned elapsed end time of sampling interval from first exposure to study treatment.

analysisVariables.name: NEFRLT

analysisVariables.name: AEFRLT

analysisVariables.description: Total treatment duration, as measured in units given in DOSEDURU, derived from PCRFEDTM-PCRFDTM. This record is generally considered to be associated with an infusion dose and is distinct from TRTDURD, TRTDURM, and TRTDURY, which reference the duration of the entire study rather than the duration of a single treatment event.

analysisVariables.name: ADOSEDUR

analysisVariables.description: The analysis visit description; required if an analysis is done by nominal, assigned or analysis visit. AVISIT may contain the visit names as observed (i.e., from SDTM VISIT), derived visit names, time window names, conceptual descriptions (such as Average, Endpoint, etc.), or a combination of any of these. AVISIT is a derived field and does not have to map to VISIT from the SDTM. AVISIT represents the analysis visit of the record, but it does not mean that the record was analyzed. There are often multiple records for the same subject and parameter that have the same value of AVISIT. ANLzzFL and other variables may be needed to identify the records selected for any given analysis. See ADaMIG v1.2, Section 3.3.8, for information about flag variables. AVISIT should be unique for a given analysis visit window. In the event a record does not fall within any predefined analysis time-point window, AVISIT can be populated in any way that the producer chooses to indicate this fact (i.e., blank or "Not Windowed"). The way that AVISIT is calculated, including the variables used in its derivation, should be indicated in the variable metadata for AVISIT. The values and the rules for deriving AVISIT may be different for different parameters within the same dataset. Values of AVISIT are producer-defined and are often directly usable in clinical study report (CSR) displays.
analysisVariables.label: Analysis Visit
analysisVariables.name: AVISIT

analysisVariableSets.label: ADNCA Standard with Stronger Core for Non-Compartmental Analysis
analysisVariableSets.name: Standard   with Stronger Core for Non-Compartmental Analysis

dataStructures.description: One record per subject per parameter per analysis visit per analysis timepoint
dataStructures.label: Basic Data Structure Non-Compartmental Analysis
dataStructures.name: ADNCA

description: The purpose of this document is to present the Analysis Data Model (ADaM) Basic Data Structure (BDS) as the specification for the input dataset for NCA. The ADaM Implementation Guide (ADaMIG) for NCA datasets specifies many of the variables needed for calculation of parameters using NCA and provides general naming conventions that can be leveraged for additional variables. This document also provides provides specific guidance for all commonly needed variables and should be viewed as the ADaM BDS class plus additional NCA variables.
label: Analysis Data Model Implementation Guide for Non-compartmental Analysis
name: ADaMIG NCA v1.0
source: Prepared by the CDISC Analysis Data Model Team	CDISC Analysis Data Model Team
